meanings.sent1: After realizing the pill didn't go down, she had to reswallow it.
meanings.sent2: He reswallowed the food that had gotten stuck in his throat.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept reswallowing the same piece of kibble, thinking it was a new treat.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was reswallowing her words as she apologized for her mistake.
meanings.sent5: The river seemed to reswallow the small fish that tried to swim upstream.

meanings.sent1: His reswallowing of the medicine showed his determination to get better.
meanings.sent2: The doctor recommended frequent reswallowing of water to ease the sore throat.
meanings.sent3: The reswallowing of the same piece of gum made everyone laugh at the silly mistake.
meanings.sent4: The reswallowing of pride was necessary for them to reconcile and move forward.
meanings.sent5: The reswallowing of the key by the mischievous toddler caused quite a commotion in the house.
